Description: Fragment of shoulder of North Ionian pottery dinos (or possibly krater); strong vertical curvature; interior reserved but smooth; exterior, cream slip; shoulder glazed with incised pendant lotus bud and flower chain with added red; below, single band and black-figure animal frieze to left; rear of probable goat, pursued by lion (forepart and part of a raised paw).
Curator's comments: From same vase as 1965,0930.495, which preserves the turn to the neck.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.1193)
Acquisition name: Exchanged with: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
Acquisition notes: Obtained from the Ashmolean Museum in exchange for fragment B102.26.
